intro: Scorzonera rosea, commonly known as the common scorzonera, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow to orange flowers and hairy, branched stems. The plant produces small, oval-shaped tubers underground, which are often used in traditional herbal medicine. Its leaves are typically alternate, with a rough texture and a strong, slightly bitter scent. Scorzonera rosea thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
